                        <h1 style="text-align: left;">Hosei Fall Study Abroad at BU CELOP</h1>
<table style="width: 100%;">
<tbody>
<tr style="width: 100%;">
<td style="width: 33.33%;">
<h2 style="text-align: center; margin: 5%;">About the Program</h2>
</td>
<td style="width: 2533.33;">
<h2 style="text-align: center; margin: 5%;"><a href="/celop/hosei/application/">Application & Pre-Arrival</a></h2>
</td>
<td style="width: 33.33%;">
<h2 style="text-align: center; margin: 5%;"><a href="/celop/hosei/student-life">Student Life</a></h2>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p><!-----LEFT COLUMN BEGINS HERE-----></p>
<div style="float: left; width: 48%;">
<h2>3 Week Pre-Course</h2>
<p>In the Pre-Course, you will study with other Hosei University students. This is a time for you to get used to communicating in English and living at Boston University before the CELOP Fall Semester begins. Your Pre-Course study will include</p>
<ul>
<li>Class 9:00 – 12:00 Monday to Friday</li>
<li>Field Trips</li>
</ul>
<p>At the end of your pre-course, you will take a placement exam to determine your enrollment for the Fall semester.</p>
<div style="width: 94%; border: 1px solid black; padding: 3%; margin-top: 5%;">
<h2>Fall Semester</h2>
<h3>Core Class<br>
9:00 – 12:00 Monday – Friday</h3>
<h4>What are core classes?</h4>
<p>Core classes are the basis of CELOP’s intensive English programs. Classes are integrated instruction in all four language skills: speaking, listening, reading, and writing. The purpose of the Core classes is to:</p>
<ul id="events">
<li><span class="date"><span class="day">1</span></span>help students develop accuracy and fluency in the four language skills.</li>
</ul>
<ul id="events">
<li><span class="date"><span class="day">2</span></span>help students develop their vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation.</li>
</ul>
<ul id="events">
<li><span class="date"><span class="day">3</span></span>provide opportunities for students to strengthen their cultural and academic awareness and adaptation.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4 Concentrations Offered</h4>
<p>Low to intermediate level students will take English Language and Culture.</p>
<div class="bu_collapsible_container " aria-live="polite" data-customize-animation="false" style="overflow: hidden;"><h3 class="bu_collapsible" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0" role="button" style="cursor: pointer;">English Language and Culture</h3><div class="bu_collapsible_section" style="display: none;"><p></p>
<p><strong>Class activities in this concentration may include:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Participating in cultural and academic discussions</li>
<li>Reading, discussing and writing about current topics</li>
<li>Working with classmates on group projects</li>
<li>Listening to and discussing media broadcasts</li>
<li>Understanding US culture</li>
<li>Preparing oral presentations on topics of interest</li>
</ul>
<p></p></div>
</div>

<p>High-intermediate and advanced level students can choose from the following 3 concentrations.</p>
<div class="bu_collapsible_container " aria-live="polite" data-customize-animation="false" style="overflow: hidden;"><h3 class="bu_collapsible" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0" role="button" style="cursor: pointer;">English for Academic Purposes</h3><div class="bu_collapsible_section" style="display: none;"><p></p>
<p><strong>Who should choose this concentration?</strong><br>
Those at the high-intermediate level or above who are preparing to attend an American-style university.</p>
<p><strong>Class activities in this concentration may include:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Participating in academic discussions</li>
<li>Understanding academic lectures</li>
<li>Taking lecture notes</li>
<li>Developing research skills</li>
<li>Writing academic English</li>
<li><span style="font-size: 13px; line-height: 19px;">Reading academic texts</span></li>
</ul>
<p></p></div>
</div>

<div class="bu_collapsible_container " aria-live="polite" data-customize-animation="false" style="overflow: hidden;"><h3 class="bu_collapsible" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0" role="button" style="cursor: pointer;">English for Science and Technology</h3><div class="bu_collapsible_section" style="display: none;"><p></p>
<p><strong>Who should choose this concentration?</strong><br>
Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on English for science and technology, either for academic or professional purposes, for example, those interested in dentistry, medicine, computer science, or engineering.</p>
<p><strong>Class activities in this concentration may include:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Participating in discussions on science and technology</li>
<li>Understanding and using sci/tech vocabulary</li>
<li>Developing research skills</li>
<li>Writing on sci/tech topics</li>
<li>Reading sci/tech articles from current sources</li>
<li>Presenting scientific concepts and observations</li>
</ul>
<p></p></div>
</div>

<div class="bu_collapsible_container " aria-live="polite" data-customize-animation="false" style="overflow: hidden;"><h3 class="bu_collapsible" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0" role="button" style="cursor: pointer;">International Business English</h3><div class="bu_collapsible_section" style="display: none;"><p></p>
<p><strong>Who should choose this concentration?</strong><br>
Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on business English, either for academic or professional purposes.</p>
<p><strong>Class activities in this concentration may include:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Participating in discussions, meetings and negotiations</li>
<li>Understanding and using business vocabulary</li>
<li>Learning how to function in the global business environment</li>
<li>Reading and discussing case studies, business texts and articles</li>
<li>Writing on business topics</li>
<li>Developing business presentation skills</li>
</ul>
<p></p></div>
</div>

<h3>Elective Class<br>
1:30 – 4:00 Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Thursday</h3>
<p>Students will select 1 elective.  Visit the <a href="https://www.bu.edu/celop/academics/programs/semester-programs/elective-classes/">Elective Class Descriptions</a> page for examples.</p>
</div>
</div>

  • Meet students from all over the world

  • Learn American history right where it all happened in Boston

  • Visit some of America's favorite cultural institutions like the Museum of Fine Arts

  • Experience American holidays and customs first hand

  • Connect with BU students and make long-lasting friendships

  • Celebrate your academic achievements with us

  • 2

Hosei Fall Study Abroad at BU CELOP

About the Program

Application & Pre-Arrival

Student Life

3 Week Pre-Course

In the Pre-Course, you will study with other Hosei University students. This is a time for you to get used to communicating in English and living at Boston University before the CELOP Fall Semester begins. Your Pre-Course study will include

  • Class 9:00 – 12:00 Monday to Friday
  • Field Trips

At the end of your pre-course, you will take a placement exam to determine your enrollment for the Fall semester.

Fall Semester

Core Class 9:00 – 12:00 Monday – Friday

What are core classes?

Core classes are the basis of CELOP’s intensive English programs. Classes are integrated instruction in all four language skills: speaking, listening, reading, and writing. The purpose of the Core classes is to:

  • 1help students develop accuracy and fluency in the four language skills.
  • 2help students develop their vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation.
  • 3provide opportunities for students to strengthen their cultural and academic awareness and adaptation.

4 Concentrations Offered

Low to intermediate level students will take English Language and Culture.

English Language and Culture

Class activities in this concentration may include:

  • Participating in cultural and academic discussions
  • Reading, discussing and writing about current topics
  • Working with classmates on group projects
  • Listening to and discussing media broadcasts
  • Understanding US culture
  • Preparing oral presentations on topics of interest

High-intermediate and advanced level students can choose from the following 3 concentrations.

English for Academic Purposes

Who should choose this concentration? Those at the high-intermediate level or above who are preparing to attend an American-style university.

Class activities in this concentration may include:

  • Participating in academic discussions
  • Understanding academic lectures
  • Taking lecture notes
  • Developing research skills
  • Writing academic English
  • Reading academic texts

English for Science and Technology

Who should choose this concentration? Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on English for science and technology, either for academic or professional purposes, for example, those interested in dentistry, medicine, computer science, or engineering.

Class activities in this concentration may include:

  • Participating in discussions on science and technology
  • Understanding and using sci/tech vocabulary
  • Developing research skills
  • Writing on sci/tech topics
  • Reading sci/tech articles from current sources
  • Presenting scientific concepts and observations

International Business English

Who should choose this concentration? Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on business English, either for academic or professional purposes.

Class activities in this concentration may include:

  • Participating in discussions, meetings and negotiations
  • Understanding and using business vocabulary
  • Learning how to function in the global business environment
  • Reading and discussing case studies, business texts and articles
  • Writing on business topics
  • Developing business presentation skills

Elective Class 1:30 – 4:00 Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Thursday

Students will select 1 elective.  Visit the Elective Class Descriptions page for examples.

Program Dates

Tuesday, September 4 – Friday, December 14, 2018.

Meet Your Program Coordinator & Pre-Course Teacher

Coming Soon

Meet Program Alumni

Hosei students have attended BU CELOP since 2000.  Meet some of them on our Hosei alumni page!

# Hosei Fall Study Abroad at BU CELOP
## About the Program
| 
## [Application & Pre-Arrival](https://www.bu.edu/celop/hosei/application/)
| 
## [Student Life](https://www.bu.edu/celop/hosei/student-life)  
---|---|---  
## 3 Week Pre-Course
In the Pre-Course, you will study with other Hosei University students. This is a time for you to get used to communicating in English and living at Boston University before the CELOP Fall Semester begins. Your Pre-Course study will include
  * Class 9:00 – 12:00 Monday to Friday
  * Field Trips


At the end of your pre-course, you will take a placement exam to determine your enrollment for the Fall semester.
## Fall Semester
### Core Class 9:00 – 12:00 Monday – Friday
#### What are core classes?
Core classes are the basis of CELOP’s intensive English programs. Classes are integrated instruction in all four language skills: speaking, listening, reading, and writing. The purpose of the Core classes is to:
  * 1help students develop accuracy and fluency in the four language skills.


  * 2help students develop their vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation.


  * 3provide opportunities for students to strengthen their cultural and academic awareness and adaptation.


#### 4 Concentrations Offered
Low to intermediate level students will take English Language and Culture.
### English Language and Culture
**Class activities in this concentration may include:**
  * Participating in cultural and academic discussions
  * Reading, discussing and writing about current topics
  * Working with classmates on group projects
  * Listening to and discussing media broadcasts
  * Understanding US culture
  * Preparing oral presentations on topics of interest


High-intermediate and advanced level students can choose from the following 3 concentrations.
### English for Academic Purposes
**Who should choose this concentration?** Those at the high-intermediate level or above who are preparing to attend an American-style university.
**Class activities in this concentration may include:**
  * Participating in academic discussions
  * Understanding academic lectures
  * Taking lecture notes
  * Developing research skills
  * Writing academic English
  * Reading academic texts


### English for Science and Technology
**Who should choose this concentration?** Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on English for science and technology, either for academic or professional purposes, for example, those interested in dentistry, medicine, computer science, or engineering.
**Class activities in this concentration may include:**
  * Participating in discussions on science and technology
  * Understanding and using sci/tech vocabulary
  * Developing research skills
  * Writing on sci/tech topics
  * Reading sci/tech articles from current sources
  * Presenting scientific concepts and observations


### International Business English
**Who should choose this concentration?** Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on business English, either for academic or professional purposes.
**Class activities in this concentration may include:**
  * Participating in discussions, meetings and negotiations
  * Understanding and using business vocabulary
  * Learning how to function in the global business environment
  * Reading and discussing case studies, business texts and articles
  * Writing on business topics
  * Developing business presentation skills


### Elective Class 1:30 – 4:00 Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Thursday
Students will select 1 elective. Visit the [Elective Class Descriptions](https://www.bu.edu/celop/academics/programs/semester-programs/elective-classes/) page for examples.
## Program Dates
Tuesday, September 4 – Friday, December 14, 2018.

                        <h1 style="text-align: left;">Hosei Fall Study Abroad at BU CELOP</h1>
<table style="width: 100%;">
<tbody>
<tr style="width: 100%;">
<td style="width: 33.33%;">
<h2 style="text-align: center; margin: 5%;">About the Program</h2>
</td>
<td style="width: 2533.33;">
<h2 style="text-align: center; margin: 5%;"><a href="/celop/hosei/application/">Application & Pre-Arrival</a></h2>
</td>
<td style="width: 33.33%;">
<h2 style="text-align: center; margin: 5%;"><a href="/celop/hosei/student-life">Student Life</a></h2>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<p><!-----LEFT COLUMN BEGINS HERE-----></p>
<div style="float: left; width: 48%;">
<h2>3 Week Pre-Course</h2>
<p>In the Pre-Course, you will study with other Hosei University students. This is a time for you to get used to communicating in English and living at Boston University before the CELOP Fall Semester begins. Your Pre-Course study will include</p>
<ul>
<li>Class 9:00 – 12:00 Monday to Friday</li>
<li>Field Trips</li>
</ul>
<p>At the end of your pre-course, you will take a placement exam to determine your enrollment for the Fall semester.</p>
<div style="width: 94%; border: 1px solid black; padding: 3%; margin-top: 5%;">
<h2>Fall Semester</h2>
<h3>Core Class<br>
9:00 – 12:00 Monday – Friday</h3>
<h4>What are core classes?</h4>
<p>Core classes are the basis of CELOP’s intensive English programs. Classes are integrated instruction in all four language skills: speaking, listening, reading, and writing. The purpose of the Core classes is to:</p>
<ul id="events">
<li><span class="date"><span class="day">1</span></span>help students develop accuracy and fluency in the four language skills.</li>
</ul>
<ul id="events">
<li><span class="date"><span class="day">2</span></span>help students develop their vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation.</li>
</ul>
<ul id="events">
<li><span class="date"><span class="day">3</span></span>provide opportunities for students to strengthen their cultural and academic awareness and adaptation.</li>
</ul>
<h4>4 Concentrations Offered</h4>
<p>Low to intermediate level students will take English Language and Culture.</p>
<div class="bu_collapsible_container " aria-live="polite" data-customize-animation="false" style="overflow: hidden;"><h3 class="bu_collapsible" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0" role="button" style="cursor: pointer;">English Language and Culture</h3><div class="bu_collapsible_section" style="display: none;"><p></p>
<p><strong>Class activities in this concentration may include:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Participating in cultural and academic discussions</li>
<li>Reading, discussing and writing about current topics</li>
<li>Working with classmates on group projects</li>
<li>Listening to and discussing media broadcasts</li>
<li>Understanding US culture</li>
<li>Preparing oral presentations on topics of interest</li>
</ul>
<p></p></div>
</div>

<p>High-intermediate and advanced level students can choose from the following 3 concentrations.</p>
<div class="bu_collapsible_container " aria-live="polite" data-customize-animation="false" style="overflow: hidden;"><h3 class="bu_collapsible" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0" role="button" style="cursor: pointer;">English for Academic Purposes</h3><div class="bu_collapsible_section" style="display: none;"><p></p>
<p><strong>Who should choose this concentration?</strong><br>
Those at the high-intermediate level or above who are preparing to attend an American-style university.</p>
<p><strong>Class activities in this concentration may include:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Participating in academic discussions</li>
<li>Understanding academic lectures</li>
<li>Taking lecture notes</li>
<li>Developing research skills</li>
<li>Writing academic English</li>
<li><span style="font-size: 13px; line-height: 19px;">Reading academic texts</span></li>
</ul>
<p></p></div>
</div>

<div class="bu_collapsible_container " aria-live="polite" data-customize-animation="false" style="overflow: hidden;"><h3 class="bu_collapsible" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0" role="button" style="cursor: pointer;">English for Science and Technology</h3><div class="bu_collapsible_section" style="display: none;"><p></p>
<p><strong>Who should choose this concentration?</strong><br>
Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on English for science and technology, either for academic or professional purposes, for example, those interested in dentistry, medicine, computer science, or engineering.</p>
<p><strong>Class activities in this concentration may include:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Participating in discussions on science and technology</li>
<li>Understanding and using sci/tech vocabulary</li>
<li>Developing research skills</li>
<li>Writing on sci/tech topics</li>
<li>Reading sci/tech articles from current sources</li>
<li>Presenting scientific concepts and observations</li>
</ul>
<p></p></div>
</div>

<div class="bu_collapsible_container " aria-live="polite" data-customize-animation="false" style="overflow: hidden;"><h3 class="bu_collapsible" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0" role="button" style="cursor: pointer;">International Business English</h3><div class="bu_collapsible_section" style="display: none;"><p></p>
<p><strong>Who should choose this concentration?</strong><br>
Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on business English, either for academic or professional purposes.</p>
<p><strong>Class activities in this concentration may include:</strong></p>
<ul>
<li>Participating in discussions, meetings and negotiations</li>
<li>Understanding and using business vocabulary</li>
<li>Learning how to function in the global business environment</li>
<li>Reading and discussing case studies, business texts and articles</li>
<li>Writing on business topics</li>
<li>Developing business presentation skills</li>
</ul>
<p></p></div>
</div>

<h3>Elective Class<br>
1:30 – 4:00 Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Thursday</h3>
<p>Students will select 1 elective.  Visit the <a href="https://www.bu.edu/celop/academics/programs/semester-programs/elective-classes/">Elective Class Descriptions</a> page for examples.</p>
</div>
</div>
<p><!-----LEFT COLUMN ENDS HERE-----></p>
<p><!-----RIGHT COLUMN BEGINS HERE-----></p>
<div style="float: right; width: 48%;">
<div style="width: 94%; border: 1px solid black; padding: 3%; margin-bottom: 5%;">
<h2 style="text-align: left;">Program Dates</h2>
<p>Tuesday, September 4 – Friday, December 14, 2018.</p>
</div>
<div style="width: 100%;"><img src="/celop/files/2016/01/Hosei-Farewell-e1454012401151-1024x512.jpg" alt="Hosei Farewell" style="width: 100%; border: 1px solid black;" class="alignnone size-large wp-image-13847" srcset="https://www.bu.edu/celop/files/2016/01/Hosei-Farewell-e1454012401151-1024x512.jpg 1024w, https://www.bu.edu/celop/files/2016/01/Hosei-Farewell-e1454012401151-600x300.jpg 600w, https://www.bu.edu/celop/files/2016/01/Hosei-Farewell-e1454012401151.jpg 1368w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" width="1024" height="512"></div>
<div style="width: 94%; border: 1px solid black; padding: 3%; margin-top: 5%; margin-bottom: 5%;">
<h2 style="text-align: left;">Meet Your Program Coordinator & Pre-Course Teacher</h2>
<p>Coming Soon</p>


<h2 style="text-align: left;">Meet Program Alumni</h2>
<p>Hosei students have attended BU CELOP since 2000.  Meet some of them on our <a href="https://www.bu.edu/celop/hosei/alumni/" title="Alumni">Hosei alumni page</a>!</p>
</div>
<div style="width: 100%; margin-bottom: 5%;"><img src="/celop/files/2016/01/BU-CAS1.jpg" alt="BU-CAS1" width="577" border:="" 1px="" solid="" black="" class="alignnone" height="300"></div>
</div>

Hosei Fall Study Abroad at BU CELOP

About the Program

Application & Pre-Arrival

Student Life

3 Week Pre-Course

In the Pre-Course, you will study with other Hosei University students. This is a time for you to get used to communicating in English and living at Boston University before the CELOP Fall Semester begins. Your Pre-Course study will include

  • Class 9:00 – 12:00 Monday to Friday
  • Field Trips

At the end of your pre-course, you will take a placement exam to determine your enrollment for the Fall semester.

Fall Semester

Core Class 9:00 – 12:00 Monday – Friday

What are core classes?

Core classes are the basis of CELOP’s intensive English programs. Classes are integrated instruction in all four language skills: speaking, listening, reading, and writing. The purpose of the Core classes is to:

  • 1help students develop accuracy and fluency in the four language skills.
  • 2help students develop their vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation.
  • 3provide opportunities for students to strengthen their cultural and academic awareness and adaptation.

4 Concentrations Offered

Low to intermediate level students will take English Language and Culture.

English Language and Culture

Class activities in this concentration may include:

  • Participating in cultural and academic discussions
  • Reading, discussing and writing about current topics
  • Working with classmates on group projects
  • Listening to and discussing media broadcasts
  • Understanding US culture
  • Preparing oral presentations on topics of interest

High-intermediate and advanced level students can choose from the following 3 concentrations.

English for Academic Purposes

Who should choose this concentration? Those at the high-intermediate level or above who are preparing to attend an American-style university.

Class activities in this concentration may include:

  • Participating in academic discussions
  • Understanding academic lectures
  • Taking lecture notes
  • Developing research skills
  • Writing academic English
  • Reading academic texts

English for Science and Technology

Who should choose this concentration? Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on English for science and technology, either for academic or professional purposes, for example, those interested in dentistry, medicine, computer science, or engineering.

Class activities in this concentration may include:

  • Participating in discussions on science and technology
  • Understanding and using sci/tech vocabulary
  • Developing research skills
  • Writing on sci/tech topics
  • Reading sci/tech articles from current sources
  • Presenting scientific concepts and observations

International Business English

Who should choose this concentration? Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on business English, either for academic or professional purposes.

Class activities in this concentration may include:

  • Participating in discussions, meetings and negotiations
  • Understanding and using business vocabulary
  • Learning how to function in the global business environment
  • Reading and discussing case studies, business texts and articles
  • Writing on business topics
  • Developing business presentation skills

Elective Class 1:30 – 4:00 Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Thursday

Students will select 1 elective.  Visit the Elective Class Descriptions page for examples.

Program Dates

Tuesday, September 4 – Friday, December 14, 2018.

Meet Your Program Coordinator & Pre-Course Teacher

Coming Soon

Meet Program Alumni

Hosei students have attended BU CELOP since 2000.  Meet some of them on our Hosei alumni page!

# Hosei Fall Study Abroad at BU CELOP
## About the Program
| 
## [Application & Pre-Arrival](https://www.bu.edu/celop/hosei/application/)
| 
## [Student Life](https://www.bu.edu/celop/hosei/student-life)  
---|---|---  
## 3 Week Pre-Course
In the Pre-Course, you will study with other Hosei University students. This is a time for you to get used to communicating in English and living at Boston University before the CELOP Fall Semester begins. Your Pre-Course study will include
  * Class 9:00 – 12:00 Monday to Friday
  * Field Trips


At the end of your pre-course, you will take a placement exam to determine your enrollment for the Fall semester.
## Fall Semester
### Core Class 9:00 – 12:00 Monday – Friday
#### What are core classes?
Core classes are the basis of CELOP’s intensive English programs. Classes are integrated instruction in all four language skills: speaking, listening, reading, and writing. The purpose of the Core classes is to:
  * 1help students develop accuracy and fluency in the four language skills.


  * 2help students develop their vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation.


  * 3provide opportunities for students to strengthen their cultural and academic awareness and adaptation.


#### 4 Concentrations Offered
Low to intermediate level students will take English Language and Culture.
### English Language and Culture
**Class activities in this concentration may include:**
  * Participating in cultural and academic discussions
  * Reading, discussing and writing about current topics
  * Working with classmates on group projects
  * Listening to and discussing media broadcasts
  * Understanding US culture
  * Preparing oral presentations on topics of interest


High-intermediate and advanced level students can choose from the following 3 concentrations.
### English for Academic Purposes
**Who should choose this concentration?** Those at the high-intermediate level or above who are preparing to attend an American-style university.
**Class activities in this concentration may include:**
  * Participating in academic discussions
  * Understanding academic lectures
  * Taking lecture notes
  * Developing research skills
  * Writing academic English
  * Reading academic texts


### English for Science and Technology
**Who should choose this concentration?** Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on English for science and technology, either for academic or professional purposes, for example, those interested in dentistry, medicine, computer science, or engineering.
**Class activities in this concentration may include:**
  * Participating in discussions on science and technology
  * Understanding and using sci/tech vocabulary
  * Developing research skills
  * Writing on sci/tech topics
  * Reading sci/tech articles from current sources
  * Presenting scientific concepts and observations


### International Business English
**Who should choose this concentration?** Those at the high-intermediate level or above who want to focus on business English, either for academic or professional purposes.
**Class activities in this concentration may include:**
  * Participating in discussions, meetings and negotiations
  * Understanding and using business vocabulary
  * Learning how to function in the global business environment
  * Reading and discussing case studies, business texts and articles
  * Writing on business topics
  * Developing business presentation skills


### Elective Class 1:30 – 4:00 Monday/Wednesday or Tuesday/Thursday
Students will select 1 elective. Visit the [Elective Class Descriptions](https://www.bu.edu/celop/academics/programs/semester-programs/elective-classes/) page for examples.
## Program Dates
Tuesday, September 4 – Friday, December 14, 2018.
![Hosei Farewell](https://www.bu.edu/celop/files/2016/01/Hosei-Farewell-e1454012401151-1024x512.jpg)

Coming Soon
## Meet Program Alumni
Hosei students have attended BU CELOP since 2000. Meet some of them on our [Hosei alumni page](https://www.bu.edu/celop/hosei/alumni/ "Alumni")!
